1.name: This Land Is Mine
1.description: A mild-mannered school-teacher in a Nazi-occupied town during W.W.II finds himself being torn between collaboration and resistance.

2.name: Shadow of a Doubt
2.description: A young woman discovers her visiting uncle may not be the man he seems to be.

3.name: Destination Tokyo
3.description: In order to provide information for the first air raid over Tokyo, a U.S. submarine sneaks into Tokyo Bay and places a spy team ashore.

4.name: Air Force
4.description: The crew of an Air Force bomber arrives in Pearl Harbor in the aftermath of the Japanese attack and is sent on to Manila to help with the defense of the Philippines.

5.name: The Song of Bernadette
5.description: A young peasant girl saw a divine miracle. The phenomenon became widely known and changed the lives of many.

6.name: The Outlaw
6.description: Western legends Pat Garrett, Doc Holliday and Billy the Kid are played against each other over the law and the attentions of vivacious country vixen Rio McDonald.

7.name: For Whom the Bell Tolls
7.description: During the Spanish Civil War, an American allied with the Republicans finds romance during a desperate mission to blow up a strategically important bridge.

8.name: The Life and Death of Colonel Blimp
8.description: From the Boer War through World War II, a soldier rises through the ranks in the British military.

9.name: Batman
9.description: Japanese spymaster Prince Daka operates a covert espionage organization located in Gotham City's now-deserted Little Tokyo which turns American scientists into pliable zombies.

10.name: Madame Curie
10.description: Despite himself, accomplished physicist and avowed bachelor Pierre Curie falls for brilliant student Marie, and together they embark on the discovery of radium.

11.name: Jane Eyre
11.description: After a harsh childhood, orphan Jane Eyre is hired by Edward Rochester, the brooding lord of a mysterious manor house, to care for his young daughter.

12.name: Heaven Can Wait
12.description: An old roué arrives in Hades to review his life with Satan, who will rule on his eligibility to enter the Underworld.

13.name: The North Star
13.description: A Ukrainian village must suddenly contend with the Nazi invasion of June 1941.

14.name: Forever and a Day
14.description: During World War II, an American travels to Britain to sell an old house near London that belongs to his family. However, he meets Leslie Trimble who lives in the house and who is ...                See full summary »

15.name: Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man
15.description: After being awakened, Larry Talbot chips Frankenstein's Monster out of a block of ice. When Talbot changes to the Wolf Man, the two creatures battle each other.

16.name: Lassie Come Home
16.description: After her destitute family is forced to sell her, a collie named Lassie escapes from her new owner and begins the long trek from Scotland to her Yorkshire home.

17.name: Phantom of the Opera
17.description: A disfigured violinist haunts the Paris Opera House.

18.name: Sahara
18.description: After the fall of Tobruk in 1942, during the Allied retreat in the Libyan desert, an American tank picks-up a motley group of survivors but they face advancing Germans and a lack of water.

19.name: So Proudly We Hail!
19.description: A group of nurses returning from the war in the Phillippines recall their experiences in combat and in love.

20.name: Above Suspicion
20.description: Oxford Professor Richard Myles and new bride Frances are off on a European honeymoon. It isn't your typical honeymoon though, for they are on a spying mission for British intelligence on ...                See full summary »

21.name: Vredens dag
21.description: The young wife of an aging priest falls in love with his son amidst the horror of a merciless witch hunt in 17th century Denmark.

22.name: Sherlock Holmes in Washington
22.description: Sherlock Holmes and Doctor Watson travel to Washington D.C. in order to prevent a secret document from falling into enemy hands.

23.name: I Walked with a Zombie
23.description: A nurse is hired to care for the wife of a sugar plantation owner, who has been acting strangely, on a Caribbean island.

24.name: Edge of Darkness
24.description: After two years under German rule, a small Norwegian fishing village rises up and revolts against the occupying Nazis.

25.name: The Miracle of Morgan's Creek
25.description: After an all-night send-off party for the troops, a small-town girl wakes up to find herself married and pregnant, but with no memory of her husband's identity.

26.name: The More the Merrier
26.description: During the World War II housing shortage in Washington, two men and a woman share a single apartment and the older man plays Cupid to the other two.

27.name: Cabin in the Sky
27.description: A compulsive gambler dies during a shooting, but he'll receive a second chance to reform himself and to make up with his worried wife.

28.name: Münchhausen
28.description: This lavish, impudent, adult fairy tale takes the viewer from 18th-century Braunschweig to St. Petersburg, Constantinople, Venice, and then to the moon using ingenious special effects, stunning location shooting.

29.name: A Stranger in Town
29.description: In the small town of Crown Port local attorney Bill Adams is trying to break up the ring of corrupt town officials by running for mayor. The cards seemed stacked against him when he gets ...                See full summary »

30.name: Stormy Weather
30.description: The relationship between an aspiring dancer and a popular songstress provides a retrospective of the great African American entertainers of the early 1900s.

31.name: A Guy Named Joe
31.description: A dead World War II bomber pilot named Pete Sandidge, becomes the guardian angel of another pilot, Ted Randall. He guides Ted through battle and helping him to romance his old girlfriend, despite her excessive devotion to Sandidge's memory.

32.name: Hangmen Also Die!
32.description: After the Nazi administrator of Czechoslovakia is shot, his assassin tries to elude the Gestapo and struggles with his impulse to give himself up as hostages are executed.

33.name: Lady of Burlesque
33.description: After one member of their group is murdered, the performers at a burlesque house must work together to find out who the killer is before they strike again.

34.name: 'Gung Ho!': The Story of Carlson's Makin Island Raiders
34.description: The true story of Carlson's Raiders and their World War II attack on Makin Island.

35.name: The Seventh Victim
35.description: A woman in search of her missing sister uncovers a Satanic cult in New York's Greenwich Village, and finds that they may have something to do with her sibling's random disappearance.

36.name: Ossessione
36.description: Gino, a drifter, begins an affair with inn-owner Giovanna as they plan to get rid of her older husband.

37.name: Watch on the Rhine
37.description: A German-born engineer, his American wife and their children travel from Mexico to the United States to visit her family but their plans are complicated by a Romanian count.

38.name: Sugata Sanshirô
38.description: Sugata, a young man, struggles to learn the nuance and meaning of judo, and in doing so comes to learn something of the meaning of life.

39.name: A Lady Takes a Chance
39.description: A city girl on a bus tour of the West encounters a handsome rodeo cowboy who helps her forget her simpy city suitors.

40.name: Crash Dive
40.description: A submarine lieutenant and his commander fall in love with the same girl.

41.name: Hoppy Serves a Writ
41.description: Sheriff Hoppy has to find a way to bring the bad guys, headed by Tom Jordan, to justice in the Lone Star state. The problem is that they are hiding out beyond his jurisdiction, in Oklahoma.

42.name: Sherlock Holmes Faces Death
42.description: During WWII several murders occur at a convalescent home where Dr. Watson has volunteered his services. He summons Holmes for help and the master detective proceeds to solve the crime from ...                See full summary »

43.name: Bataan
43.description: In 1942, in the Bataan peninsula of the Philippines, a ragtag American unit commanded by Sergeant Bill Dane attempts to blow-up a bridge in order to slow the Japanese advance.

44.name: Le corbeau
44.description: French village doctor becomes target of poison-pen letters sent to village leaders, accusing him of affairs and practicing abortion.

45.name: Son of Dracula
45.description: Count Alucard finds his way from Budapest to the swamps of the Deep South; his four nemeses are a medical doctor, a university professor, a jilted fiancé and the woman he loves.

46.name: The Gang's All Here
46.description: A soldier falls for a chorus girl and then experiences trouble when he is posted to the Pacific.

47.name: Action in the North Atlantic
47.description: An American tanker's sunk by a German U-boat and the survivors spend 11 days at sea on a raft. Their next assignment; bound for Murmansk through the sub-stalked N. Atlantic.

48.name: Five Graves to Cairo
48.description: During World War II, an undercover British soldier tries get word to the Allies that the Germans have tons of supplies buried in five excavations across Egypt.

49.name: Stage Door Canteen
49.description: "Dakota" Smith (William Terry), a young soldier on a pass in New York City, visits the famed Stage Door Canteen, where famous stars of the theatre and movies appear and host a recreational ...                See full summary »

50.name: Journey Into Fear
50.description: An American ballistics expert in Turkey finds himself targeted by Nazi agents. Safe passage home by ship is arranged for him, but he soon discovers that his pursuers are also on board.
